text: ah I just finished watching that speech
and now I'm feeling pretty based hi
everyone Anthony Fantana here intranets
busiest music nerd and it's time for a
review black dice mr. impossible black
dice is a Brooklyn experimental music
outfit this is their latest LP their
early stuff was was more akin to genres
such as experimental rock and noise rock
but these days their music incorporates
way more electronics samples guitars
slathered and the strangest of effects
and all these sounds come together to
make some of the oddest sound scapes
I've ever heard
black dice definitely produces music
that does not hold too many musical
conventions do not go into this thing
expecting clear chord progressions or a
lot of harmony much less lyrics or
intelligible vocals instead expect some
pretty noisy guitars playing very fart
around riffs and leads lots of grunts
and and mouth noises and grimy sampled
beats pulsating in a very mechanical way
considering a lot of the guitars have a
very buzzing quality to them serve like
a group of flies swarming around my head
but the thing is the sounds that black
dice chooses though they are noisy and
they are strange for the most part
they're very bright and and quirky
almost cartoonish and and I would dare
say fun there's no feeling of difficulty
or harshness or massive amounts of depth
that you usually get in experimental
music like this instead black dice
shoots for something that's way more
kind of light-hearted they feel as as
weird as Captain Beefheart but as
playful as Deerhoof
sounds on here don't feel really densely
layered or heavy they're actually pretty
easy to pull apart making this album
very readable for an album that's that's
comprised mostly of noise or what seems
like noise black dice has been playing
with this style for several albums now
including repo and load blown and I
would say mr. Impossibles is their most
accessible moment yet in this vein the
music isn't really subtly layered or
anything like that
black dice sort of puts all of the
weirdness out there to be consumed on a
first impression which isn't a bad thing
the issue for me with this album is how
the sounds black dice chooses mesh or
don't sometimes to me listening to this
album can be a lot like walking into a
room with a cuckoo clocks hanging all
over the walls in every direction all of
these clocks making very different and
distinct noises but they all happen to
be making them on this one timed plane
it's a congruent cacophony and to me
there's nothing really all that
impressive or memorable with how the
sounds on this album clash or work
together to tell you the truth some of
my least favorite parts on this LP are
the spots where the sounds seem like
they're intended to to sort of work
together like on the eight-minute track
carnitas where the synth phrases and the
drumbeats though they do kind of hit in
an accessible way at first they get a
little boring after a while other times
like I said the sounds on these tracks
sort of seemed to be on the same tempo
coexisting but in a very separated and
disconnected way there are some spots on
here where the sounds do work together
in a really fun way there's all sorts of
tempo and sound changes throughout the
track songs like pigs and the jacker
those are fun tracks that I like a lot
there's a lot of color and they're not
long-winded by any means black dice
definitely piss all over all the rules
and expectations for recorded music but
they kind of go a
about it in this very one-trick pony
kind of way all the sounds and colors
sort of hit me all at once in this in
this really exciting way it's kind of a
rush but as I listen to this LP more and
more and more the sounds really aren't
complementing one another doing anything
together they were just kind of abducted
and thrown into this mix and they don't
know where they are or who they are or
who these other sounds are all they know
is they just want to be left alone this
record and black dice in general have a
lot of personality and there's something
to be said for that there are not a lot
of groups that sound like black dice so
I'm kind of feeling a strong five to a
light six on this record but that
doesn't matter what do you happen to
feel on the inside in regards to the
music on this release does it grab your
soul shake it and then rip it to shreds
and then eat it or does it make you on a
hotwire a car and crash into the nearest
tree let me know
Anthony Fantana black dice mr.
impossible
